meanings.sent1: The white shirt was stainable and easily absorbed the spilled juice.
meanings.sent2: The wooden table was stainable, so the family decided to use a tablecloth to protect it.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy found out the hard way that the carpet was stainable after knocking over the paint can.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation was as stainable as a white shirt in a spaghetti-eating contest.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was so stainable that even a tiny drop of coffee left a noticeable mark.

meanings.definition: Able to be marked or discolored.
meanings.sent1: The old book's pages were stainable from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The delicate fabric was stainable, so she was careful while eating spaghetti.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child discovered that the walls were stainable with crayons.
meanings.sent4: His memory was as stainable as a white shirt in a spaghetti-eating contest.
meanings.sent5: The reputation of the company was so stainable that even a small mistake caused a big problem.
